name: Travel Website
description: Applied NodeJS, Express with MongoDB and Pug templates to create a travel website. Functionalities include registration/login, admin features to create/delete new packages, filter travel packages, and gather data on user purchases and popular packages

name: Windows Wallpapers
description: Windows does not natively support wallpaper slideshows for multiple monitors. I created a python app to automatically detect number of monitors, screen resolution, and orientation both on initialization and while running.  The application sorts landscape/portrait photos and generates a new background photo based on a timer.

name: GhostRacer Game
description: Created a game to apply Object Oriented Programming in C++, using two classes in Actors and GameWorld to implement a driving game. All Actors activities are done through passing a virtual function to the GameWorld, while GameWorld keeps track of all existing Actors and orchestrates all gameplay.

name: Process Model Compilation
description: Historical process model results were not in accessible files, making analysis difficult. I created a tool that parsed the historical results into a common database, and analyzed the results. After validating with live plant data, I identified process modification opportunities that improved yields and gas oil sales by $100k/y

name: Resume Builder
description: Created a basic resume builder for a friend looking for applications. The program pulls data from a csv or Google Sheets document, and parses all of the data into a formatted Google Docs file.

name: Cross Functional Testing
description: After identifying various plant vulnerabilities from trending data and performing a risk analysis, I lead a cross-refinery team to test historical limits on high risk equipment. Ultimately, through the collaborative efforts of the engineering team, we were able to gather valuable data and improve boiler burner utilization by ~20%

name: Controls Vulnerability
description: Refinery utilities systems were over 50years old, and had various risks. I analyzed all historical data of shutdown incidents and found various opportunities in controls logic. I developed new controls logic and additional monitoring tools to fully eliminate various trip risks and logic, reducing annual quantified risk by $10MM/year

name: Production Model Analysis
description: I was responsible for model validation and analysis for mine operations. Following debugging and verification using Python, I built a tool to analyze millions of data points, ultimately identifying a single point of failure in the proposed project that would have costed over $50MM/year.

name: Cooling Tower Initiative
description: After analyzing temperature trends with cooling water temperatures, I noticed it was possible to perform maintenance without rentals during Winter months (never done before). After consulting specialists and confirming its viability, I interfaced and lead a cross-functional team to develop and implement a bypass system to capture $1.5MM reduction in operating expenses
